data.title: Wonderfull-tiny-pricey
data.text: Our family wanted to try some european restaurants which we really prefer, being from Europe. This was a great choice. We had chicken soups. They were what we really wanted, clear, brothy and tasty. My wife had a tripe soup. It tasted just as we are used to. As a main course we ordered strogonof and bigos. Both very nice dishes however, we'd welcome a little bigger portions. I don't remember last time I left a restaurant half hungry after $120 check. Overall, tasty dishes, fantastic combinations of spices, but very small and pricey.

data.title: Excellent food, great environment!
data.text: Possibly overlooked by the location on Lincoln blvd, this place has hands down the best authentic Polish cuisine. We went during happy hour and loved the sampler plate, the pierogies and the stuffed cabbage. We even ordered another sampler plate because we enjoyed it so much. The back restaurant has a very cute outdoor vibe with lights and a patio. The prices were reasonable. I'd highly recommend it.

data.title: Fun
data.text:
Same Polish restaurant, with a different name. Very fun. Our group sat outside, on comfortable pillows. The food was good, the vodka was good, mixed drinks were so-so. 
We were disappointed that they were out of duck - surprising because we were there early, but found plenty to  eat nonetheless. 
Service was kind and attentive. We will be back - but will call first to make sure they have the duck. 
Oh yeah, the table turns into a fire pit. Love that!

data.title: Formerly Warszawa, now renamed Solidarity
data.text: This authentic Polish restaurant, I am told, has been around for years.  Formerly, the ever popular Warszawa, has been renamed and rebranded Solidarity with the owner's daughter in charge.  What hasn't changed, thank goodness, is the authentic Polish cuisine that will melt your heart and make you want to travel to Eastern Europe.  Set in a old house, it makes you feel like you have been invited over for home cooked Polish food by your favorite friends.  We started off with ice-cold martinis (oh so good, the Bison grass polish vodka) and could have just stayed with the pierogis all night long.  Instead, I had the huge house salad with grilled salmon (fantastic) and my husband had the golaki (stuffed cabbage), pricey but good.  For domestic and international travelers this is a restaurant that is memorable and close to the Santa Monica Pier and beach.  Authentic Polish for sure.
